meaningMnemonic:
Anywhere with lots of <kanji>steam</kanji> is going to get hot and sticky, so this word means... <vocabulary>to get hot and sticky</vocabulary>!

With 蒸れる, something gets hot and sticky due to trapped heat and moisture, like sweaty armpits under a shirt on a humid day, or a sticky bottom after sitting at a desk for a while.

Additionally, 蒸れる can mean <vocabulary>to be steamed</vocabulary>, like what happens to rice as it softens in a rice cooker.
readingMnemonic: What is making things <vocabulary>get hot and sticky</vocabulary>? Not many people know this, but it’s actually all of the cows going <reading>moo</reading> (む). With how much they moo, they create so much steam that everything is turning hot and sticky. Who could’ve known?!
